sourcing.instructions: La: Purchase from a chemical supplier or online (e.g., Sigma-Aldrich); Li: Obtain from battery manufacturing suppliers; Pr: Source from rare earth material suppliers; Sb: Buy from metal suppliers or online chemical stores.
steps: La: Purchase from a chemical supplier or online (e.g., Sigma-Aldrich); Li: Obtain from battery manufacturing suppliers; Pr: Source from rare earth material suppliers; Sb: Buy from metal suppliers or online chemical stores.

1. Weigh out 10.0 g of La, 20.0 g of Li, 10.0 g of Pr, and 40.0 g of Sb using an analytical balance. 2. Place all powdered materials into a clean, dry mixing container. 3. Use a mortar and pestle to thoroughly mix the powders until a homogeneous blend is achieved. 4. Transfer the mixture into a ceramic crucible for the heating process.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Weigh out 10.0 g of La, 20.0 g of Li, 10.0 g of Pr, and 40.0 g of Sb using an analytical balance. 2. Place all powdered materials into a clean, dry mixing container. 3. Use a mortar and pestle to thoroughly mix the powders until a homogeneous blend is achieved. 4. Transfer the mixture into a ceramic crucible for the heating process.

steps: 1. Preheat a muffle furnace to 800°C. 2. Once the furnace reaches the desired temperature, place the ceramic crucible with the mixed powder inside. 3. Maintain the temperature for 4 hours to ensure complete reaction of the materials.
heating.raw_text: 1. Preheat a muffle furnace to 800°C. 2. Once the furnace reaches the desired temperature, place the ceramic crucible with the mixed powder inside. 3. Maintain the temperature for 4 hours to ensure complete reaction of the materials.

steps: 1. After 4 hours, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool to room temperature naturally (approximately 6-8 hours). 2. Do not open the furnace door until it has cooled down to prevent any thermal shock to the material.
cooling.raw_text: 1. After 4 hours, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool to room temperature naturally (approximately 6-8 hours). 2. Do not open the furnace door until it has cooled down to prevent any thermal shock to the material.

steps: 1. Remove the crucible from the furnace once cooled. 2. Carefully extract the solidified material from the crucible. 3. Use sandpaper (grit 400) to smooth out the edges and surface of the solid sample. 4. Clean the surface with a soft cloth to remove any residual dust. 5. Optionally seal the surface with a clear epoxy resin to enhance durability and appearance.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Remove the crucible from the furnace once cooled. 2. Carefully extract the solidified material from the crucible. 3. Use sandpaper (grit 400) to smooth out the edges and surface of the solid sample. 4. Clean the surface with a soft cloth to remove any residual dust. 5. Optionally seal the surface with a clear epoxy resin to enhance durability and appearance.
